page.title: 05The Beck, Snape, Yorkshire.
page.content: The Beck is a pretty part of the village.It starts at Roskill,flows through Snape to Snape Mill,then it branches into various drainage channels,some of which flow into Bedale Beck and eventually lead to the River Swale.The Beck at one stage flows beside Snape Castle.It flows under the road about four times and through many people's gardens. The Beck is about 1m wide and a quarter of a metre deep in most places.Flowers like daffodils, celandines, forget-me-nots and buttercups grow beside it. Minnows, frogs and water voles are found in certain places. The Beck is often cleaned out using gripes and diggers.
